give preferred length multiple of 20 stitches when using a thinner yarn the foundation chain length should be increased from the pattern and when using a thicker yarn the foundation chain length should be decreased example scarves image 1 solid mustard colour a foundation chain of 140 stitches was used which resulted in a circumference of 120 cm relaxed the yarn used does have a reasonable amount of give when crocheted loosely so the circumference increases a little when draped gauge is approximately 8 6 cm at the maximum width of a single triangle two triangle repeats have been completed on each side of the base chain image 2 multi-colour a foundation chain of 220 stitches was used which resulted in a circumference of 138 cm relaxed this yarn also has some give so the circumference is slightly bigger when draped gauge is approximately 6 3 cm at the maximum width of a single triangle base three triangle repeats have been completed on each side of the base chain image 3 solid mushroom colour a foundation chain of 100 stitches was used gauge is approximately 8 6 cm at the maximum width of a single triangle two triangle repeats have been completed on each side of the base chain pattern overview the scarf is constructed by working multiple row from the base chain first in one direction and then in the other i e  the photographed scarves are two triangles in width either side of the base chain  one triangle width requires 4 row therefore to construct two triangles either side of the base chain 8 row are required per side so this equates to 16 row in total to complete the scarf the pattern is always worked on the right side without turning the scarf can be constructed from a single coloured yarn alternative colour options include  work one colour one side of the base chain and another colour the other side  work one colour for the first triangle repeat on either side of the base chain the inner part of the circular scarf and then work another colour on the second triangle repeat on either side of the base chain the outer part of the circular scarf  using a graduated colour change yarn  using a variegated yarn the second repeat of triangles each side of the base chain can be either worked off centre as per images 1 and 2 or inline as per image 3 with respect to the first repeat of triangles to get started please go to next page
